page.title: 02Culcheth Carnival
page.content: In June every year there is a Carnival in Culcheth. There is a big procession of different floats all round the village. The best dressed float won a prize. Some were funny, such as one with pirates on who were squirting water at everybody, and pretending to drink beer. Other floats were make-believe, like Humpty Dumpty and Little Bo Peep. The procession ends on the field over the road from the High School, and then the Carnival fair starts. There are funny stalls like wet a wally, when you throw a ball and if you hit the container full of water it tips all over the wally(idiot!). These stalls are round the field's edge. In the middle are activities such as Morris dancing, a Brass Band, a Punch and Judy show, and weight lifting.
